isis.stitle: 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS SPICER - INSTALL - RANGE CASE

step1.para: Install the range countershaft shims and retainer plates ( Figure 83).

figure.caption: Figure 83. Range Case Installation

caution.para: Make sure the shims are in line with the plate holes to help ensure proper transmission operation.

step1.para: Tighten the bolts to 34 to 41 ft-lbs. (46 to 56 N•m).
Check the main box countershaft end play ( Figure 84).

figure.caption: Figure 84. Main Box Countershaft End Play

caution.para: Make sure end play is between .003 and .008 inch on each countershaft. This will help ensure proper transmission functioning.

step1.para: Install the countershaft reverse gears ( Figure 85). These gears only fit in one position because of the blind spline. Secure each gear with a washer and bolt. Tighten the bolts to 78 to 98 ft-lbs. (106 to 133 N•m).

figure.caption: Figure 85. Install Countershaft Reverse Gears

step1.para: Install the reverse gear and thrust plate ( Figure 86).

figure.caption: Figure 86. Install Reverse Gear and Thrust Plate

step1.para: Place the range countershafts in the housing ( Figure 87). This is easiest to do if you lift up slightly on the reverse gear.

figure.caption: Figure 87. Range Countershafts in Housing

step1.para: Install the high range drive gear ( Figure 88). Align the timing marks.

figure.caption: Figure 88. Install High Range Drive Gear

step1.para: Install the rear clutch drive gear and the synchronizer cup ( Figure 89). Secure them with the washer and nut. Tighten to 78 to 98 ft-lbs. (106 to 133 N•m).

figure.caption: Figure 89. Install Rear Clutch Drive Gear & Synchronizer Cup

step1.para: Install the synchronizer and fork with the synchronizer springs facing the output yoke or flange ( Figure 90). Make sure the synchronizer springs stay in place during installation. Installation is easiest if the synchronizer is in neutral. Place a new, lubricated O-ring on the fork assembly.

figure.caption: Figure 90. Install Synchronizer and Fork

step1.para: Press the tapered bearing and spacer onto the output shaft and install the assembly ( Figure 91).

figure.caption: Figure 91. Tapered Bearing & Spacer

warning.para: When pressing bearings, use a shield to protect people from possible flying parts.

step1.para: Low range gear should be centered between the countershafts.
Apply purple Loctite 515 or the equivalent to the housing face, then lower the rear case into place ( Figure 92). Tighten the case bolts to 78 to 98 ft-lbs. (106 to 133 N•m).

figure.caption: Figure 92. Apply Loctite to Housing Face

step1.para: Use a suitable driver and rubber mallet to drive the cup, spacer, cup and bearing into the case ( Figure 93). These bearings are part of a matched set.

figure.caption: Figure 93. Driver and Mallet to Drive Cup

caution.para: If one of these components is replaced, the entire set must be replaced. This will help ensure proper end play.

step1.para: Install the output bearing cap. To shim the output bearing cap, measure the distance from the end of the case to the bearing cup (A, Figure 94).

figure.caption: Figure 94. Shim Output Bearing Cap

step1.para: Measure from the face of the bearing cap to the end of the pilot (B, Figure 95). Subtract the two figures to determine the amount of shims to provide a tolerance of 0 to .004 inch.

figure.caption: Figure 95. Measure Face of Bearing Cap to End of Pilot

step1.para: Apply purple Loctite 515 or the equivalent to the output bearing cap ( Figure 96). Secure it with bolts tightened to 34 to 41 ft-lbs. (46 to 56 N•m).

figure.caption: Figure 96. Apply Loctite to Output Bearing Cap

step1.para: Install the countershaft bearings in the case ( Figure 97). Apply purple Loctite 515 or the equivalent to the bearing caps and install them. Align the bearing caps with the oil grooves in the case to help ensure proper lubrication. Tighten the bolts to 34 to 41 ft-lbs. (46 to 56 N•m).

figure.caption: Figure 97. Install Countershaft Bearings

step1.para: Assemble the two spacers and air regulator ( Figure 98). The air regulator bolts are longer than the bearing cap bolts.

figure.caption: Figure 98. Assemble Spacers and Air Regulator

step1.para: Install new O-rings on the piston and in the housing ( Figure 99). Then install the piston. The counterbore on the piston should face the new O-ring on the rod.

figure.caption: Figure 99. Install New O-rings on Piston in Housing

step1.para: Install the retaining nut and tighten to 52 to 62 ft-lbs. (70 to 84 N•m) ( Figure 100). Lubricate the piston O-ring.

figure.caption: Figure 100. Install Retaining Nut

step1.para: Install the range piston housing with the four bolts ( Figure 101). The air inlet should be at the top. Tighten to 34 to 41 ft-lbs. (46 to 56 N•m).

figure.caption: Figure 101. Install Range Piston Housing

step1.para: Install the speedometer gear and end yoke or flange ( Figure 102). Tighten the nut to 550 to 600 ft-lbs. (745 to 813 N•m).

figure.caption: Figure 102. Install Speedometer Gear and End Yoke Flange

step1.para: Place the transmission in a horizontal position ( Figure 103).

figure.caption: Figure 103. Install Clutch Housing Retainer Bolts

warning.para: When moving heavy parts, use a chain hoist to help prevent personal injury.

step1.para: Install the two clutch housing retainer bolts. Tighten to 78 to 98 ft-lbs. (106 to 133 N•m).
